definitions.definition: A polite form of address for a woman or lady .
examples: Mrs Grey wondered if the outfit she was trying on made her look fat. The sales assistant just said, “It suits you, madam ”.
Later, Mrs Grey was sitting in her favourite tea shop. “Would madam like the usual cream cakes and patisserie with her tea?” the waitress asked.
Selina kept pushing and shoving during musical chairs. The nursery school teacher said she was a bad-tempered little madam .

definitions.definition: A woman who runs a brothel , particularly one that specializes in finding prostitutes for rich and important clients.
examples: After she grew too old to work as a prostitute, she became a madam .

definitions.definition: A hated or contemptuous woman; used as a general term of abuse

main_definition: A polite form of address for a woman or lady .
secondary_definitions: ( colloquial ) A conceited or quarrelsome girl .
( slang ) A woman who runs a brothel , particularly one that specializes in finding prostitutes for rich and important clients.
( India , derogatory slang ) A hated or contemptuous woman; used as a general term of abuse
